services.name: Births, deaths, marriages and divorces
services.long_description:
The Queensland Government provides a range of services and supporting information for major life events of births, deaths, marriages and divorces.

This includes life event registration (births, deaths, marriages, registered relationships and changes of name) and issuing new and replacement life event certificates. 

We also provide marriage ceremony services and family history research.
services.prerequisites: Different services have different prerequisites (documents and information you need to provide).
services.short_description: The Queensland Government provides a range of services and supporting information for major life events of births, deaths, marriages and divorces.

services.name: Apply to change your legal name (for adults over 18 years)
services.how_to:
Step 1—Complete the online form

1. Complete all mandatory fields.
2. Download and print the completed application form.

Step 2—Sign the form and prepare your supporting documents

1. Have another adult (18 or older) witness your signature in the declaration section.
2. Get your proof of ID and supporting documents.

Note: Proof of ID documents must be submitted by post or in person. Get your documents certified by a Justice of the Peace or another authorised person, if submitting by post.

Step 3—Submit the application form

You can submit your completed application to us either:
- in person by requesting an interview appointment at the Brisbane registry customer service centre at Level 32, 180 Ann Street, Brisbane
- by post to Registry of Births, Deaths and Marriages, PO BOX 15188, CITY EAST QLD 4002.

Before submitting your printed application form:

- in person, remember to
- request an interview appointment
- read the email sent to you to confirm your appointment
- get your proof of ID and supporting documents
- by post, remember to
- total all fees in one payment
- check your credit card details and expiry date
- get your proof of ID and supporting documents certified
- allow extra time for Australia Post
services.long_description:
Use this online service to change your legal name.

You can change your legal name in Queensland once every 12 months, if you are 18 or older. You can apply to change your name if you were:

- born or adopted in Queensland
- born or adopted overseas and have lived in Queensland for the past 12 months (and currently live in Queensland).

If you were born or adopted in another Australian state or territory, you need to apply to the registry office interstate.

If your application is approved, we will send the standard certificate you choose and you will need to change your name everywhere you do business in the community.

In most cases, you do not need to apply to change your name if you are changing your name through marriage.

Note: You must pay a fee for this service.
services.prerequisites:
Queensland born or adopted applicant

You must provide:

- certified proof of ID
- evidence explaining the reason if your current name is different to your name on your birth certificate, such as a
- marriage certificate
- family deed poll document
- birth certificate
- change of name document.

Overseas born or adopted applicant

You must provide:

- certified proof of ID
- a copy of your birth certificate—if you can’t get one, you must provide an evidence of birth document, such as
- a citizenship certificate
- an Australian visa
- a travel document
- a passport issued by your country of birth with a letter from the consulate confirming your details.
- evidence explaining the reason if your current name is different to your name on your evidence of birth document, such as a
- marriage certificate
- family deed poll document
- change of name document.
- a copy of your Australian citizenship certificate, if you are a citizen.

If original documents are not in English, please have them translated into English by an accredited translators and provide a certified copy of the original document with the original translation.

You will also need to provide evidence that you are currently living and have lived in Queensland for the past 12 months, such as a letter. The letter should:

- be dated and signed by 
- your current employer
- your doctor
- your educational institution
- the Australian Electoral Commission
- your accountant
- your financial institution or bank manager
- your real estate agent
- state how long you have lived in Queensland
- state how long the person or organisation has known you
- be written on their letterhead.
services.short_description:
"You can change your legal name in Queensland once every 12 months, if you are 18 or older. You can apply to change your name if you were:

- born or adopted in Queensland
- born or adopted overseas and have lived in Queensland for the past 12 months (and currently live in Queensland)."
services.who_is_eligible:
To be eligible for this service you must be 18 years or older and either:
- born or adopted in Queensland
- born or adopted overseas and have lived in Queensland for the past 12 months (and currently live in Queensland).

services.name: Apply for a letter of no record of marriage (for Queenslanders who marry overseas)
services.how_to:
To apply for a letter of no record of marriage in Queensland, you need to:

1. Complete, download and print the completed no record of marriage application form.
2. Get your proof of ID and supporting documents (as required), certified by a Justice of the Peace or another authorised person.
3. Sign the applicant's section of the application form.
4. Pay the fee.
5. Submit your application form, payment and certified documents to us by post or in person at one of our counter services.

By post

Post your completed application form with payment and certified documents to:

Registry of Births, Deaths and Marriages
PO Box 15188
CITY EAST QLD 4002

In person

Visit any of the following locations:

- Brisbane registry customer service centre at Level 32, 180 Ann Street, Brisbane
- one of our agents at a Queensland Magistrates Court or Queensland Government Agent Program (QGAP) office (except the Brisbane Magistrates Court).

Bring your completed application form, your original proof of ID and other supporting documents (if needed).
services.long_description:
Use this service to apply for a letter of no record of marriage if you are getting married overseas and need evidence of your marriage status and history in Queensland.

Check with the consulate of the country before you go, to see if you need a letter of no record of marriage in Queensland—may also be called single status, a no impediment to marriage or no record of marriage.

You should also check with the country where you plan to get married if an apostille stamp is needed.

If your registered celebrant or the country where you plan to get married asks you for a letter of no record of marriage, you can apply to us.

The letter you receive from us after you apply will say that we have searched our Queensland marriage records using details you give us—your full name, date of birth and period of years to searched—and it will include the results of our search. This letter is an official document which will have the official seal and signature of the Registrar-General.

Note: You must pay a fee for this service.
services.prerequisites:
You must provide proof of ID and supporting documents if you have previously changed your name—such as deed poll document, or change of name certificate.

If you have been married before you must also provide supporting documents to show you are no longer married—such as evidence of divorce or a death certificate.
services.short_description: Use this service to apply for a letter of no record of marriage if you are getting married overseas and need evidence of your marriage status and history in Queensland.
services.who_is_eligible: To be eligible for this service you must be planning to get married overseas, and need to provide evidence that you are not currently married in the state where you lived before going overseas.

services.name: Apply to add your child’s biological father to their birth registration and certificate
services.how_to:
To add your child’s biological father, you need to:

1. Complete, download and print the registration form.
2. Get your supporting documents certified by a Justice of the Peace or another authorised person.
3. Attach certified proof of ID documents for each parent.
4. Attach additional supporting documents, if required.
5. Get another adult to witness your signatures on the declaration section of the registration form.
6. Pay the fee.
7. Submit your registration form, the certified documents, your payment and the birth certificate you want amended (if applicable) to us by post or in person.

By post

Post your completed registration form with your certified documents to: 

Registry of Births, Deaths and Marriages 
PO Box 15188 
CITY EAST QLD 4002

In person

Visit the Brisbane registry customer service centre at Level 32, 180 Ann Street, Brisbane.

Bring your completed registration form, your original proof of ID and other supporting documents (if needed).
services.long_description:
Use this service to apply to add your child’s biological father to their birth registration and certificate.

Normally the parents of children born in Queensland register their child’s birth together—so the birth certificate will show both the mother and father’s details.

However, if only the mother’s details are shown, you can apply to add your child’s biological father’s details at any time.

When you apply to add your child’s biological father to their birth registration and certificate:

- your names will be recorded on your child’s birth certificate as ‘mother’ and ‘father'
- your child’s surname will stay the same as registered and as shown on their birth certificate—see changing your child’s name before they turn 18 to change their surname
- you will need to return the old certificate to us for a replacement, if you have one
- if you have previously stated the father is 'unknown' or a different father was stated but not registered, we will request legal DNA evidence or a parentage order from a court.

We will not post a replacement certificate unless you return a certificate or buy a new one.

Note: You must pay a fee for this service.
services.prerequisites: You must provide certified proof of ID (identification) documents.
services.short_description:
Normally the parents of children born in Queensland register their child’s birth together—so the birth certificate will show both the mother and father’s details.

However, if only the mother’s details are shown, you can apply to add your child’s biological father’s details at any time.
services.who_is_eligible: You are eligible for this service if your child was born in Queensland and the birth certificate only shows the mother's details.

services.name: Apply to change your sex in a birth or adoption register
services.how_to:
To note your change of sex, you need to:

1. Read and understand the rules (above).
2. Complete, download and print the completed application form.
3. Get your supporting documents certified by a Justice of the Peace or another authorised person.
4. Attach your certified proof of ID documents.
5. Attach additional supporting documents and recognition certificate, if required.
6. Get another adult to witness your signature on the declaration section of the application form.
7. Get 2 doctors to complete the statutory declaration sections of your application form—including Medicare provider numbers—and have this witnessed by a Justice of the Peace or another authorised person.
8. Pay the application fee.
9. Submit your application form, return your birth certificate (if applicable) and certified documents to us, along with payment by post or in person.

By post

Post your completed application form with certified documents to:

Registry of Births, Deaths and Marriages
PO Box 15188
CITY EAST QLD 4002

In person

Visit the Brisbane registry customer service centre at Level 32, 180 Ann Street, Brisbane.

Bring your completed application form and your original proof of ID and supporting documents (if required).
services.long_description:
Use this service to change your sex in a birth or adoption register. 

You can apply for us to note your sex change if you have had sexual reassignment surgery and your birth or adoption is registered with us.

Your new birth certificate will not state that your sex has changed, it will only show your sex after sexual reassignment surgery and state that your birth has been re-registered.

Note: You must pay a fee for this service.
services.prerequisites:
You will need to provide the following with your application:

- provide evidence that you are no longer married (if you ever have been), such as a divorce or death certificate
- have 2 doctors complete the statutory declaration sections of the application form confirming your surgery. We may accept a recognition certificate in place of the 2 doctors' statutory declarations
- return your old certificate to use for replacement, if you have one
- certified proof of ID (identification) documents.
services.short_description: You can apply for us to note your sex change if you have had sexual reassignment surgery and your birth or adoption is registered with us.
services.who_is_eligible:
To be eligible for this service you must:
- have your birth or adoption registered in Queensland
- be at least 18—a child's parents or guardians can apply with court approval (in certain circumstances one parent or guardian can apply)
- have already changed your name (if you are wanting to)—if you did not change your name with us, your change of name must be noted on your birth certificate.

services.name: Bond loans and rental grants
services.how_to: Read the Guide to find out about the bond loans and rental grants
services.keywords:
Housing and Property
Renters
Concessions
Grants
services.long_description:
Use this service to find out about bond loans and rental grants.

A Bond Loan is an interest-free and fee-free loan to cover the rental bond when you move into private rental accommodation.

The loan amount is a maximum of 4 weeks rent and must be repaid.

Bond loans are available to eligible people only.

Bond Loan Plus is an interest-free and fee-free loan to cover the rental bond plus an amount equal to 2 weeks rent for the property you want to rent.

The loan amount is a maximum of 6 weeks rent and must be repaid.

To find out more, talk to your local Housing Service Centre.

A Rental Grant is a one-off grant of 2 weeks rent for people in a housing crisis. It helps pay for the cost of moving into private rental accommodation.

Rental Grants are available to eligible people only.

Check your eligibility
services.prerequisites:
You will need to provide for each applicant:

  • proof of income
  • at least 2 types of identification
  • proof of Australian residency status

You will also need to provide details of the rental property.
services.short_description: Use this service to find out about bond loans and rental grants.
services.who_is_eligible:
To be eligible, all of the following conditions must be met:

Income eligibility limits are assessed on the total income for a household, not individuals within the household.

  • You don’t currently live in the property that you need bond for.
  • You’re an Australian citizen or permanent resident, or have a temporary protection or bridging visa.
  • You don’t own or part-own:
    • a residential property
    • a caravan, mobile home or live-aboard boat permanently connected to household utilities.
  • You have less than $2500 in cash or savings among all the Bond Loan applicants (not including dependents).
  • You don’t have outstanding debts with us.
  • You’re choosing a property where the rent isn’t more than 60% of the total gross weekly income of all applicants.
  • You meet the current income limits:
services.agency_name: Department of Housing and Public Works

services.name: Apply for a Bond Loan Plus
services.how_to:
You can apply for a bond loan or rental grant in any of the following ways:

Online 
1. Complete the online form
2. Submit the online form

Email
1. Complete the application form
2. Scan the completed form and your supporting evidence 
3. Email the form and your supporting evidence to bondloan@hpw.qld.gov.au

Post
1. Complete the application form
2. Scan the completed form and your supporting evidence 
3. Post the form and your supporting evidence to: 
Bond Loan Statewide Services Team
PO Box 1120
Bundaberg QLD 4670

Fax
1. Complete the application form
2. Scan the completed form and your supporting evidence
3. Fax the form and supporting evidence to 1300 762 514

In person
1. Bring your completed application and your supporting evidence to your nearest Housing Service Centre, Queensland Government Agent Program (QGAP) office or Courthouse
You can use the Housing Assist Qld App too. It can be downloaded from Apple, Android and Windows stores.
You can apply for a bond loan and or Rental Grant, check eligibility, apply for a pre-approval, check your balance
and reveal your bond loan repayment barcode on the app.
services.in_person: Bring your completed application and your supporting evidence to your nearest Housing Service Centre, Queensland Government Agent Program (QGAP) office or Courthouse

services.long_description: A Bond Loan is an interest-free and fee-free loan to cover the rental bond when you move into private rental accommodation.
services.prerequisites:
You will need to provide for each applicant:

  • proof of income
  • at least 2 types of identification
  • proof of Australian residency status

You will also need to provide details of the rental property.
services.short_description: Apply for an interest-free loan to cover the cost of bond to move into a new home
services.who_is_eligible:
To be eligible, all of the following conditions must be met:

  • You don’t currently live in the property that you need bond for.
  • You’re an Australian citizen or permanent resident, or have a temporary protection or bridging visa.
  • You don’t own or part-own:
    • a residential property
    • a caravan, mobile home or live-aboard boat permanently connected to household utilities.
  • You have less than $2500 in cash or savings among all the Bond Loan applicants (not including dependents).
  • You don’t have outstanding debts with us.
  • You’re choosing a property where the rent isn’t more than 60% of the total gross weekly income of all applicants.
  • You meet the current income limits:
    • Weekly income

      (before tax)

      Type of household

      $ 1,013

      One adult $ 1,519

      Two adults $ 2,025

      Three adults $ 2,531

      Four adults $ 1,316

      One adult with one dependant $ 1,620

      One adult with two dependants $ 1,924

      One adult with three dependants $ 2,228

      One adult with four dependants $ 1,823

      Two adults with one dependant $ 2,126

      Two adults with two dependants $ 2,430

      Two adults with three dependants $2,734

      Two adults with four dependants

      To calculate income eligibility for household types not listed above, please use the information below:

      First adult: $1,012.56

      Each additional adult $506.28

      Each dependant $303.77

      The total household income limit is then rounded to the nearest dollar.

      Income eligibility limits are assessed on the total income for a household, not individuals within the household.
services.agency_name: Department of Housing and Public Works

services.keywords:
Housing and Property
Renters
Concessions
Grants
services.long_description: A Rental Grant is a one-off grant of 2 weeks rent for people in a housing crisis. It helps pay for the cost of moving into private rental accommodation.
services.prerequisites:
You will need to provide for each applicant:

  • proof of income
  • at least 2 types of identification
  • proof of Australian residency status

You will also need to provide details of the rental property.

You must also provide documentary evidence that you meet 1 of the following conditions:

  • you stayed more than 28 continuous days in a homelessness service (e.g. emergency housing or a women's shelter), or in accommodation arranged by a homelessness service, and apply for the Rental Grant within 3 months of leaving
  • you have left a correctional facility after staying at least 28 days, and apply for the Rental Grant within 3 months of leaving
  • you have left a hospital or health facility within the last 3 months, stayed there for at least 28 days, and apply for the Rental Grant within 3 months of leaving
  • you are leaving a child protection service
  • you or a member of your household is escaping domestic and family violence
  • you are homeless or at risk of becoming homeless
  • you are leaving a community-based rent scheme in Queensland to move into private rental accommodation, and apply for the rental grant within 14 days of leaving.
services.short_description: Apply for a grant to pay the first 2 weeks of your rent when moving into a rental property
services.who_is_eligible:
• You don’t currently live in the property that you need bond for.
  • You’re an Australian citizen or permanent resident, or have a temporary protection or bridging visa.
  • You don’t own or part-own:
    • a residential property
    • a caravan, mobile home or live-aboard boat permanently connected to household utilities.
  • You have less than $2500 in cash or savings among all the Bond Loan applicants (not including dependents).
  • You don’t have outstanding debts with us.
  • You’re choosing a property where the rent isn’t more than 60% of the total gross weekly income of all applicants.
  • You meet the current income limits
  • You have not received a Rental Grant before.

Additionally, you must meet at least one of these conditions:

  • You’re leaving either a department-approved centre (e.g. emergency housing, women’s shelter) or housing arranged by an approved centre where you spent more than 28 continuous days and you’re applying for assistance within 3 months of leaving.
  • You’ve been discharged from a correctional facility after serving at least 28 days and you’re applying for assistance within 3 months of your release.
  • You’ve been discharged from a hospital or health facility, including mental health facility, within the last 3 months where you were a resident for at least 28 days.
  • You’ve exited support from a child protection service within the last 3 months where you were a resident for at least 28 days or are still in care.
  • You are currently experiencing domestic and family violence.
  • You’re leaving housing provided by a community-based rent scheme in Queensland to move into private rental housing and applying for assistance within 14 days of leaving.
  • You’re homeless or at risk of becoming homeless.

2. Submit the form
services.keywords:
Housing and Property

Grants
services.long_description: If you don't have your bond loan repayment card, you can use this service to get your card's barcode and BPay reference number online.
services.prerequisites: You will need your bond loan number
services.short_description: Get your bond loan repayment details
services.agency_name: Department of Housing and Public Works

services.name: Find out how to repay your bond loan
services.how_to:
You can repay your Bond Loan by:
- EasyPay—if you receive an income support payment from Centrelink
- BPay—use phone or internet banking by inputting the BPay Biller Code (747337) and your BPay reference number (15 digit customer reference number) printed on your repayment card
- repayment card—pay at any Australia Post Office or agency
- automatic payments—your bank can set up a transfer directly from your bank account to the department to repay your Bond Loan
- cheque/money order—make cheque/money order payable to the Department of Housing and Public Works. Also include your name and Bond Loan account number in the envelope, and post to:
Shared Service Agency
Housing Revenue 
GPO Box 1210
BRISBANE QLD 4001

If you don't have your repayment card, you can get your card's barcode and BPay reference number online.
services.keywords:
Housing and Property
Renters
Concessions
Grants
services.long_description:
Use this service to find out how to repay your bond loan.

Your bond loan must be repaid within the loan term you were approved for—18 months, 24 months or 30 months. If you want to, you can pay your bond loan back earlier.
services.prerequisites: You will need your bond loan number
